image.altText: A photo of hand holding plastic pieces.

props.synopsis: Environment groups cleaning and re-cleaning remote northern Australian beaches of rubbish are calling on the federal government to do more to stop plastic being produced.

title.children: Australia considers mandating recycled plastic packaging as beaches drown in rubbish

image.altText: A long exposure shows a nuclear plant illuminated at night, with a white cloud of steam emerging from the top of two reactors.

props.synopsis: We asked Australia's largest energy companies, fund managers and a mining billionaire whether they think nuclear is a viable option for meeting our emissions targets â€” "unicorns" and "impossible without subsidies" were some of the responses we got back.Â

title.children: The Coalition says nuclear energy is 'commercially viable'. This is what the experts think

image.altText: Anthony Albanese smiles as he puts his arm around Narendra Modi. Modi is making a fist. The background behind them is dark.

props.synopsis: The long arm of the Indian state is reaching Australians with threats against members of the Indian diaspora, the amassing of political power, and never-before-reported details of a "nest of spies".

title.children: When Australia quietly expelled four Indian spies, Modi's government thought it had avoided embarrassment

image.altText: Close-up Bruce Lehrmann in Toowoomba Magistrates Court sketch.

props.synopsis: It is the first time Mr Lehrmann has appeared personally at Toowoomba Magistrates Court since he was charged with two counts of rape in December 2022.

title.children: Complainant in rape case against Bruce Lehrmann begins giving evidence in court

image.altText: Li Qiang and Anthony Albanese speaking at podiums in front of the China and Australian flags

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese will host a lunch for China's Premier Li Qiang during the high-level visit, while supporters and protesters line the streets with some scuffles breaking out. Follow live.

title.children: PM lauds agreements on education and climate signed during Chinese premier's visit

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ðŸ“¹ PM Anthony Albanese and China Premier Li Qiang's remarks
China hopeful for improved relations after visit

image.altText: Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese cross paths in the House of Representatives.Â

props.synopsis: The past week has given us a taste of the degustation of political messages we are about to be bombarded with ahead of the next election. And it isn't pretty.

title.children: We've seen it in the US election, and now it's happening here. What is behind the rise of 'double haters'?

image.altText: Selwyn Cobbo of the Maroons fends off Nicho Hynes of the Blues during State of Origin

props.synopsis: Queensland names its squad for Origin II, with Selwyn Cobbo left out despite playing a crucial role in the Maroons' Origin I victory.

title.children: 'It was best for Selwyn': Slater explains leaving Cobbo out of Maroons side for Game II

image.altText: A shark in the water close to an outboard engine.

props.synopsis: A professional fisherman says he is "racing" sharks almost every time he brings in his catch, and that shark numbers are making it almost impossible to fish in certain areas.

title.children: Sharks caught on camera taking fishers' catch raises concern about increased interaction

image.altText: A man wearing a hat stands at a gated entrance to a rural property.

props.synopsis: Farmers fear a company that "couldn't do the right thing" when exploring western NSW for rare earth minerals won't be able to manage if its project goes into full production.

title.children: Rule-breaching miner's billion-dollar plan raises red flags for farmers

image.altText: A drone image of Wadeye.

props.synopsis: For many years, the NT community of Wadeye has faced ongoing social unrest, fuelled by intergenerational disadvantage. Now, new plans are on the table for its future.

title.children: 'No silver bullet': Major plan to move residents out of Wadeye after years of unrest

image.altText: A screenshot of a Coles loyalty points scam text message that asks customers to click on the link to redeem their points

props.synopsis: Scammers are using loyalty point programs as the latest way to try to trick you. To keep you safe, here are the common signs to watch out for.Â

title.children: Coles and Telstra are being impersonated by scammers. Here's how to spot a phishing scam

image.altText: An older man with grey hair siles at the camera wearing a brown suit and a blue patterened tie. He stands in a dimly lit room.

props.synopsis: Fry is a long-term campaigner for the sculptures to be returned and supports the British Museum displaying exact replicas made by a team of archaeologists from 3D scans of the marbles.

title.children: 'There is a sacredness about the marbles': Why Stephen Fry thinks his country should return the Parthenon marbles

image.altText: Siddarth stands behind Chetna with his hand on her shoulder as they both look out the window of their partially built apartment.

props.synopsis: Multiple families say their dealings with the Victorian Managed Insurance Authority have been worse than the collapse of their builder.Â

title.children: It's been four years since this Victorian family's builder fled the country. Their home is still not finished

image.altText: Freshly baked bread cools on a kitchen bench at Salty's cafe and bakery on the Cocos Islands.

props.synopsis: The smell of fresh artisan sourdough greets visitors after they fly in to the Cocos (Keeling) Islands. The bread is the brainchild of Tony Lacy, who is making the most of the remote island's limited produce.

title.children: Turning saltwater into sourdough on a remote tropical island

image.altText: A man wearing white chef clothes and a black watch

props.synopsis: The world-renowned celebrity chef is grateful he survived what he says could have been a disastrous incident.

title.children: 'It really shook me': Gordon Ramsay escapes major injury after cycling crash

image.altText: The back of a blonde woman's head.

props.synopsis: After a stalker tracked Isla's car and bugged her home, she was given a similar tracking device. She wants all DV survivors to be offered one.

title.children: Isla is a DV survivor, so why does she take a tracking device everywhere she goes?

image.altText: Singer John Farnham standing next to his son Rob at his wedding. John is wearing a black suit while rob is wearing a cream suit

props.synopsis: After an oral cancer diagnosis in August 2022, John Farnham looks to be in good spirits with his family at his son's wedding.

title.children: John Farnham pictured at son's wedding in first images shared since cancer surgery

image.altText: Rows of blue planes with Southwest written on them all grounded.

props.synopsis: The US National Transportation Safety Board is also investigating why another Boeing 737 MAX 8 "rolled" during a flight last month.Â

title.children: Boeing 737 MAX 8s under investigation following 'Dutch Roll' and near-miss over Pacific

image.altText: A crowd of people holding out bowls.

props.synopsis: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu criticises plans announced by the military to hold daily tactical pauses in fighting along one of the main roads into Gaza.Â

title.children: Israeli PM denounces tactical pauses in Gaza fighting to get in aid

image.altText: Surface scum in the Murray River from the blue green algae outbreak in April 2016.

props.synopsis: The River Murray is expected to emit an unpleasant odour this week but experts say it has been years since they have seen it so healthy.

title.children: River stink no cause for alarm as ecosystem strengthens to bring exciting new life

image.altText: A man in a wheelchair.

props.synopsis: For months, a community push has been growing for international student Dev Deka to be granted permanent residency after an alleged assault left him as a paraplegic. The federal immigration minister says he's "looking into it".

title.children: Immigration minister 'looking into' push to grant Indian student residency after alleged assault left him paraplegic

image.altText: Alex De Minaur

props.synopsis: Australia's Alex de Minaur climbs to seventh in the world rankings after beating Sebastian Korda in the Libema Open final.

title.children: De Minaur reaches career-high ranking after claiming victory in Dutch tournament

image.altText: Marcus Bontempelli, Nick Daicos and Dustin Martin

props.synopsis: Nick Daicos teaches a coaching icon a major lesson, Marcus Bontempelli continues his dominance, and a magical Dustin Martin milestone moment at the MCG.

title.children: AFL Round-Up: Bontempelli's masterpiece, Daicos's lesson to coaching icon and Dusty's magical milestone moment

image.altText: Composite image of Kyle Feldt, Alex Johnston and Tohu Harris

props.synopsis: Alex Johnston's 191st try in the NRL moves him past one rugby league legend and put another in his sights. Here are the biggest talking points from every game of round 15.

title.children: NRL Round-Up: Rabbit passes a legend to create history as wingers make the superhuman look normal

image.altText: A man in a light pink shirt speaks into microphones with an Aboriginal flag and crowd of supporters behind him

props.synopsis: The determination marks the first occasion on Australia's east coast where native title has been recognised in a heavily urbanised area.

title.children: Kabi Kabi people recognised as Sunshine Coast native title holders in landmark Federal Court decision

image.altText: A male rower sits on a rowing machine in a gym

props.synopsis: Concussion brought an end to Riley Rees-Turner's promising footy career, but in a radical pivot the 23-year-old is now targeting the Los Angeles Olympics in rowing â€” a sport undergoing a huge change for the 2028 Games. Â

title.children: The accidental rower who's got his sights set on the Olympic Games

image.altText: A primary school student receives a piece of toast with jam.

props.synopsis: As families struggle to keep their kitchens stocked, the cost-of-living crisis is drawing attention to the role of schools in providing healthy food to students â€” something that experts say also promotes their mental health.

title.children: This school is seeing more kids arrive without food. It's stepping in to help

image.altText: Prince William, Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis

props.synopsis: Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis post a touching Father's Day message for Prince William, sharing an image taken by Catherine, the Princess of Wales.Â

title.children: 'We love you, Papa': Touching Father's Day message to Prince William from the royal children

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: While Wall Street enjoyed a strong week, a flat final session has left the ASX without much momentum. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: ASX set to slip as Wall St rally pauses, former AFL boss Gillon McLahlan to run Tabcorp

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX down 0.2% heading into the afternoon
Tabcorp appoints former AFL chief Gil McLaughlin as new CEO

image.altText: A house visible through trees and behind a picket fence

props.synopsis: A woman in her 80s and a man in his 60s, who police believe to be her son, have been killed in a house fire at Woodridge, south of Brisbane.Â

title.children: 'A terrible blow': Queensland's deputy premier pays tribute to mother and son killed in Logan house fire

image.altText: Heimgartner crash

props.synopsis: Broc Feeney wins both races in Darwin, as Andre Heimgartner finds himself on the roof of an opponent after a crash on the first lap.

title.children: Car ends up on roof of opponent, as Feeney claims both Supercars races in Darwin
